Job DetailsJob Title - Policy & Governance Manager Level II (AI & ML)Location - Los Angeles, CA - RemoteDuration - 12 Months ContractPay Rate - $58.00 - $62.00/hour on W2 without benefitsJob description:• Team is looking for an AI Policy & Governance Manager with expertise in policy issues related to artificial intelligence and machine learning to join our Privacy and Data Policy team.• In this role, you'll help shape the company's external approach to AI governance issues while internally aligning our approach across our suite of applied machine learning products and services.• You'll work closely with product managers, engineers, researchers, and cross-functional partners across the company, as well as with policy makers, academics, civil society representatives and industry peers, to develop and implement strategic external policy initiatives on AI related topics like privacy, fairness, transparency, amongst others.• The ideal candidate for this role is a self-starter, a good team player, and creative problem solver that can switch easily between detailed work and high-level strategic thinking.• Key to this role will be using initiative to be proactive about achieving the desired impact of the various projects - this means being able to reflect on the means of achieving those goals and having the confidence to push back where necessary and providing alternative routes forward.• This candidate will be deeply familiar with privacy and public policy issues in artificial intelligence.• This candidate will also have a meaningful understanding of stakeholders and perspectives in the privacy and broader policy community and be able to use this understanding to promote responsible AI development in regard to team’s products and services as well as across our industry.Job Responsibilities:• Track and analyze global legislative and regulatory proposals around AI.• Evaluate the potential impact of AI policy trends on team’s development and deployment of AI processes and AI powered products.• Work closely with cross-functional global teams to develop and communicate team’s positions on AI policy issues and proposals.• Support the global AI policy team’s work with regional policy teams to further our engagement on the EU AI Act.• Synthesize external policy developments to provide actionable guidance to our product teams, including our Responsible AI team.• Maintain and add to an AI policy stakeholder database, using creative ways to understand the debates in AI that are becoming important/relevant and may need engagement from team.• Help to develop and organise external policy initiatives and engagements on AI policy topics.• Support the development of content for global audiences (op-eds, position papers, 2-pagers etc.), to help communicate team’s legislative and public policy positions.Requirements:• Bachelor's Degree• 5+ years of experience with privacy, data security, or technology policy issues (2+ years with advanced degree).• Experience engaging with policymakers and external policy stakeholders on technology policy issues.• Experience with privacy and/or public policy issues related to artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning(ML).• Experience working directly with executives to support business decision making.• Broad understanding of AI and ML practices and the underlying technology.• Working familiarity with privacy legislative frameworks and AI governance models.• Experience with policy analysis.Disclaimer:“U.S. Tech Solutions, Inc. is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected status.”
